fields.headline: Regina Spektor: Far
fields.bodyText: The catchy tunes and quirky blend of folk-pop on Regina Spektor's fourth album, Begin to Hope, propelled the Russo-American songstress from the obscurity of New York's bar circuit to the fame and fortune of David Letterman and adverts for Vodafone. Three years on, this follow-up is just as remarkable. At first listen the polished production threatens to push Spektor into MOR Katie Melua territory, but her uncanny ability to write melodies that are simultaneously familiar and challenging, coupled with lyrics that are idiosyncratic yet everyday (from an expose of atheism to an aria on a lost wallet) make this a richly rewarding album.
